meta.title: Blood Pressure - #1 UK Blood Pressure App | Feeltracker
meta.description: The number 1 blood pressure tracking app in the United Kingdom. Track your blood pressure effortlessly with Camera Scan AI technology. Monitor systolic, diastolic, pulse, and MAP readings. Sync with Apple Health, export reports for your doctor, and discover patterns with AI insights. Available on iPhone, iPad, and Mac.

            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Camera Scan AI uses advanced optical character recognition (OCR) technology to automatically read blood pressure values from your monitor's digital display. Simply point your iPhone or iPad camera at the screen showing your systolic, diastolic, and pulse readings, and the app will automatically populate these values. This eliminates manual typing errors and makes logging faster. It works with OMRON, Microlife, Beurer, and most digital blood pressure monitors."

items.title: Camera Scan AI
items.description: Simply point your camera at your blood pressure monitor's screen and let the app automatically read and record your systolic, diastolic, and pulse values. No manual typing needed.

items.description: Seamlessly sync with Apple Health. Import your historical blood pressure data and automatically save new readings to HealthKit for comprehensive health tracking.

items.description: Discover what affects your blood pressure with intelligent pattern detection. Get personalized insights about triggers, lifestyle factors, and trends over time.

howItWorks.title: How Blood Pressure Works
howItWorks.subtitle: A comprehensive system designed for effective blood pressure management

steps.title: 1. Record Your Reading
steps.content:
**Camera Scan AI:** Simply point your camera at your blood pressure monitor's display and let AI automatically extract systolic, diastolic, and pulse values. No typing needed - the app reads the numbers directly from [OMRON](https://geni.us/B9RB), Microlife, Beurer, and most digital monitors.

**Manual Entry:** Prefer to type? Enter values manually with a streamlined interface. Takes just seconds to log a reading.

**Rich Context:** Add detailed notes about what you were doing - meals eaten, medications taken, exercise, stress levels, sleep quality, or any factors that might affect your blood pressure. You can also attach photos and tag entries with custom labels for easier searching later.

steps.title: 2. Track Patterns
steps.content:
**Calendar View:** See all your readings in an intuitive calendar layout. Each day shows your measurements with color-coded indicators for normal, elevated, or high readings based on medical guidelines.

**Automatic Statistics:** Get instant calculations of daily, weekly, and monthly averages. View your lowest and highest readings, standard deviation, and trends over time without doing any math.

**Visual Charts:** Beautiful graphs show your blood pressure trends over days, weeks, months, or any custom date range. Spot patterns at a glance and see how you're progressing toward your health goals.

steps.title: 3. Get AI Insights
steps.content:
**Pattern Detection:** AI analyzes your readings and notes to identify correlations. Discover what activities, foods, or situations consistently raise or lower your blood pressure.

**Personalized Recommendations:** Get specific insights based on your data. The AI might notice patterns like "Your BP tends to be higher on days when you mention 'stressed at work'" or "Readings are lower on days with morning exercise."

**Chat with Your Data:** Ask questions in natural language like "What was my average BP in the evenings last month?" or "Show me readings after I took my medication." The AI understands context and gives you instant answers.

steps.title: 4. Share with Your Doctor
steps.content:
**Professional Reports:** Export comprehensive PDF or Excel reports formatted for medical review. Reports include summary statistics, trend charts, medication logs, and all your notes - everything your doctor needs in one document.

**Apple Health Integration:** Automatically sync all readings to Apple Health. Import historical data from other apps or devices. Your blood pressure data stays connected with your complete health picture.

**Cloud Backup:** All data is automatically backed up to your private iCloud account. Switch devices seamlessly - your entire blood pressure history moves with you, encrypted and secure.

items.question: What is a normal blood pressure reading?
items.answer: According to medical guidelines, normal blood pressure is typically below 120/80 mmHg. Readings between 120-129 systolic and below 80 diastolic are considered elevated. Values of 130/80 or higher may indicate hypertension. However, target ranges can vary by age and health conditions, so consult your doctor for personalized guidance.

items.question: How does Camera Scan AI work?
items.answer: Simply point your iPhone or iPad camera at your blood pressure monitor's digital display. The app uses advanced AI-powered camera recognition technology to automatically read the numbers and populate the systolic, diastolic, and pulse fields. This eliminates manual typing errors and makes logging faster. [Get a blood pressure monitor here](https://geni.us/B9RB).

items.question: What is MAP and should I track it?
items.answer: MAP (Mean Arterial Pressure) is a calculated value that represents the average blood pressure in your arteries during one cardiac cycle. It's calculated as: MAP = (2 √ó Diastolic + Systolic) √∑ 3. Some doctors find MAP useful for assessing cardiovascular risk. The app automatically calculates MAP for each reading.

items.question: Can I import my old blood pressure data?
items.answer: Yes! If you've been tracking blood pressure in Apple Health, you can import all your historical readings into the app with one tap. The app also supports importing from CSV/Excel files if you have data from other sources.

items.question: How often should I check my blood pressure?
items.answer: This depends on your health condition and your doctor's recommendations. Some people check daily (often morning and evening), while others check weekly. The app makes it easy to track as frequently as recommended by your healthcare provider. You can set reminders to help maintain a consistent schedule.

items.question: Is my blood pressure data private?
items.answer: Absolutely. Your blood pressure readings are stored encrypted on your device and in your private iCloud account. The data never passes through our servers, and we cannot see your health information. It's as secure as Apple's Notes or Photos apps.

items.question: Can I track blood pressure for family members?
items.answer: The app is designed for individual use and syncs with your personal iCloud account. For tracking multiple family members, each person should use the app on their own device with their own Apple ID.

items.question: Do you show ads or track me?
items.answer:
**No.** We've completely removed all advertisements from the app. We don't track you across other apps or websites, and we never sell your data to advertisers.

Your data syncs via iCloud - just like Apple Notes and Photos. This means we don't need to know your email address, name, or any personal information. Your blood pressure data is stored on your devices and in your iCloud account, and it's completely private whether you use the free version or premium.

items.question: Do I need a subscription?
items.answer: The app is completely free to download and use. All core tracking features work without a subscription. A premium subscription unlocks advanced AI features, unlimited exports, and enhanced customization. You can try all premium features during the free trial period.

items.title: Wow....
items.content: I've used other apps before, and I will tell you the AI feedback sets this app apart from all the rest. Freaking love this thing. Always kind of felt like I was flying in the dark most the time before this. I would try and google what the variations in my pressures could be, and what to watch for. The AI feedback does it all for me. Tells me what I want to keep an eye out for, always recommends consulting my doctor on anything I'm concerned about, but provides me a fundamental information of what the changes could be. Also even incorporates the one word notes I write about what was happening at the time I took the reading. Like stressed, tired, rested, etc. Yes amazing thorough feedback of possibilities, but always cautious to not take the place of our own responsibly to see a doctor, just terrific information you can actually take with you to show your doc if for any reason your concerns cause you to consult one. The creators nailed it seriously!!! Very appreciative.

items.title: Latest update
items.content: I've been using this app for about six months now has exceeded my expectations. When I first started using it, I sent in a question to ask if it would update Apple health automatically and they said that it would be one of the things they would be looking at. As of this date, they've already made this update and it is working absolutely wonderful. The app is so simple to use and you're not have to hassle with any machine. With Omron I was always fighting to see if it would sync with Apple health, and the people that looked after the apps didn't seem to know what they were doing. This app has the ability to allow you to put your own information in and it automatically sync over to Apple health, no fuss no muss. Great App!!

features.title: Everything You Need for Mindful Journaling

items.title: Distraction-Free Writing
items.description: Clean, simple interface that puts your words first. No clutter, just you and your thoughts. Write as much or as little as you want each day.

items.title: AI Sentiment Analysis
items.description: Automatic sentiment detection shows the emotional tone of your entries using Apple's on-device Natural Language API. Completely private - never leaves your device.

items.title: AI Scanning
items.description: Scan objects, documents, receipts, or text with your camera and let AI describe them and extract text. Instantly create journal entries from real-world items.

items.title: Word Frequency Analysis
items.description: Discover what's really on your mind. See which words and themes appear most often in your writing to identify patterns and recurring thoughts.

items.title: Photo Journals
items.description: Attach up to 8 photos per entry to capture memories visually. Perfect for travel journals, gratitude diaries, or simply documenting your day.

items.title: Note Templates
items.description: Quick-start your entries with customizable templates. Perfect for gratitude journals, morning pages, goal tracking, or any recurring journaling practice.

items.title: Item Scanning
items.description: Point your camera at any object and let AI describe it with creative context for your journal. Transform everyday moments into meaningful entries.

items.title: Text Scanning
items.description: Capture text from documents, signs, or screens with AI-powered OCR. Instantly digitize written content into your journal entries.

items.title: Powerful Search
items.description: Find any entry instantly with full-text search. Your journals are also indexed in iOS Spotlight for quick access from anywhere on your device.

howItWorks.title: How Daily Journaling Works
howItWorks.subtitle: Your personal journaling companion for capturing life's moments and discovering patterns

steps.title: 1. Write Your Thoughts
steps.content:
**Instant Entry:** Open the app and start writing immediately. No setup, no configuration, no complexity. Just your thoughts and the page. The clean, distraction-free interface helps you focus on expressing yourself.

**Rich Media:** Enhance entries with photos, attach images to capture memories visually. Add voice recordings, sketches, or any media that helps tell your story. Every entry becomes a complete snapshot of your day.

**Note Templates:** Use pre-made templates for daily reflections, gratitude journaling, goal tracking, dream logs, or create your own custom templates. Templates provide structure while still giving you freedom to write naturally.

steps.title: 2. See Patterns Emerge
steps.content:
**Sentiment Analysis:** AI automatically detects the emotional tone of your entries - positive, negative, or neutral. See your mood trends visualized over weeks and months to understand your emotional patterns.

**Word Frequency:** Discover which topics, people, or themes you write about most. The app identifies recurring words and phrases, revealing what's consistently on your mind and how your focus shifts over time.

**Calendar View:** Browse your entire journaling history in a calendar interface. Each day shows an excerpt and mood indicator. Quickly jump to any past entry to see what you were thinking on that day.

steps.title: 3. Reflect and Grow
steps.content:
**AI-Powered Insights:** Ask questions about your journal: "What were my happiest days last month?" or "Show me all entries where I mentioned my goals." Get instant, thoughtful answers that help you understand your journey.

**Personal Growth Tracking:** Review how your thoughts, concerns, and aspirations evolve. See progress toward goals mentioned in past entries. Identify growth areas and celebrate how far you've come.

**Search Everything:** Powerful search finds any word, phrase, or concept across years of journaling. Filter by date, mood, or keywords. Your entire written history is instantly accessible and searchable.

steps.title: 4. Keep Everything Safe
steps.content:
**Private & Secure:** All entries are encrypted and stored in your personal iCloud account. Only you can read your journal - the app uses end-to-end encryption so your words stay completely private.

**Automatic Backup:** Weekly automatic JSON backups ensure you never lose your thoughts. Manual backup anytime to export your entire journal. Your words are protected against device loss or failure.

**Cross-Device Sync:** Write on iPhone, continue on iPad, review on Mac. All your entries sync automatically via iCloud. Your journal follows you everywhere, always up-to-date on every device.

Frequently Asked Questions

items.question: Is my journal private?
items.answer: Absolutely. Your entries are stored encrypted on your device and in your private iCloud account. We never see your writing. Even the AI sentiment analysis happens entirely on your device using Apple's Natural Language API - your words never leave your phone.

items.question: How does sentiment analysis work?
items.answer: When you write 8 or more words, the app uses Apple's built-in Natural Language framework to analyze the emotional tone. An emoji appears to show whether the entry reads as positive, negative, or neutral. This happens entirely on-device for complete privacy.

items.question: What is word frequency analysis?
items.answer: The Trends feature analyzes all your entries to show which words and topics you write about most often. This helps you identify recurring themes, concerns, or interests in your thinking.

items.question: Can I add photos to my journal?
items.answer: Yes! You can attach up to 8 photos to each journal entry. Photos are stored efficiently with automatic thumbnail generation, and they sync across all your devices via iCloud.

items.question: What are note templates?
items.answer: Templates are pre-written prompts that help you start writing quickly. Create custom templates for things like gratitude lists, daily reviews, goal tracking, or any other recurring format you use.

items.question: Can I export my journal entries?
items.answer: Yes. You can export your entries as PDF, Excel, or JSON files. This lets you create backups, share selected entries, or move your data to other platforms if needed.

items.question: Does it work on Mac?
items.answer: Yes! The app runs natively on Apple Silicon Macs (M1 and later). Your entries sync automatically between your iPhone, iPad, and Mac via iCloud.

items.question: Can I write multiple entries per day?
items.answer: Absolutely. Write as many entries as you want each day. Some people journal in the morning and evening, while others add notes throughout the day.

items.question: Do you show ads or track me?
items.answer:
**No.** We've completely removed all advertisements from the app. We don't track you across other apps or websites, and we never sell your data to advertisers.

Your data syncs via iCloud - just like Apple Notes and Photos. This means we don't need to know your email address, name, or any personal information. Your journal entries are stored on your devices and in your iCloud account, and they're completely private whether you use the free version or premium.

items.question: Do I need a subscription?
items.answer: The app is completely free to download and use. All core tracking features work without a subscription. A premium subscription unlocks advanced AI features, unlimited exports, and enhanced customization. You can try all premium features during the free trial period.

items.title: Perfect & Simple
items.content: Been looking for something exactly like this for over a year. Perfect app that does what it does without any fuss. I use this to jot down notes about tasks completed, calls made, info learned, etc. I am self-employed and wanted a simple method of keeping a record of info for the myriad projects I have going at any given time. It has a simple search function so as long as I keep my terminology/project name consistent I can pull up entries similar to tag-searching. I love the simplicity of what is essentially a calendar based notes app. I am able to make several short entries on a single date, all visible from the start screen. This feature is a huge part of the app's functionality for me because it allows me to glance at all my notes on a given day while keeping entries separated by project. There's no fancy/cutesy formatting that only shows previews of entries‚Äîyou can read the entirety of each entry right from the main calendar page.

howItWorks.title: How Mental Health Works
howItWorks.subtitle: A comprehensive mood tracking system designed for emotional wellness and mental health awareness

steps.title: 1. Log Your Mood
steps.content:
**AI Face Scanning:** Take a quick selfie and let AI analyze your facial expression to suggest a mood rating. The system detects emotional cues like smiles, frowns, and other facial indicators to provide an objective starting point for your mood entry.

**Simple Rating Scale:** Multiple times a day, rate how you're feeling on an intuitive 1-5 scale. The system is designed to be quick - it takes just seconds to log a mood, making it easy to track consistently throughout your day.

**Detailed Context:** Add notes about what's happening - activities, interactions, medications, sleep, stress triggers, positive moments, or anything affecting your emotional state. The more context you provide, the more valuable insights you'll gain.

**Emotion Labels:** Tag entries with specific emotions beyond the numeric rating - anxious, hopeful, irritable, content, overwhelmed, peaceful. Build a nuanced picture of your emotional landscape that goes deeper than simple numbers.

steps.title: 2. See Patterns
steps.content:
**Calendar Visualization:** View your complete mood history in an intuitive calendar interface. Each day displays your average mood with color coding. Instantly identify good weeks, rough patches, and emotional cycles at a glance.

**Statistical Analysis:** Automatically calculated metrics include daily, weekly, and monthly mood averages, mood stability scores, range of emotions, and trending patterns. See objective data about your emotional wellness over time.

**Trend Charts:** Beautiful graphs show your mood patterns across days, weeks, or months. Identify seasonal patterns, medication effects, therapy progress, and long-term emotional trajectories. Visual data makes patterns impossible to miss.

steps.title: 3. Discover Triggers
steps.content:
**AI Pattern Recognition:** Artificial intelligence analyzes your notes and mood ratings to identify correlations. Discover insights like "Your mood is 40% higher on days when you exercise" or "Mood drops consistently after poor sleep."

**Trigger Identification:** Learn which people, places, activities, or situations consistently affect your mental health. The AI might reveal "You rate mood lower on days mentioning work deadlines" or "Mood improves when you write about social activities."

**Conversational Insights:** Ask natural language questions: "What improves my mood most?" or "Show me my worst days this month." The AI provides thoughtful answers based on your complete emotional tracking history.

steps.title: 4. Share with Care Team
steps.content:
**Professional Reports:** Export comprehensive PDF or Excel reports formatted for clinical review. Reports include mood graphs, detailed statistics, notes about triggers and patterns, medication tracking, and therapy progress - everything your mental health provider needs.

**Apple Health Integration:** On iOS 18+, sync with Apple Health's State of Mind feature. Import mood data from other sources or export your FT tracking to HealthKit for integration with your complete health record.

**DBT & CBT Support:** Designed with input from mental health professionals. Features support Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT) and Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) techniques. Track emotions, identify thought patterns, and monitor therapeutic progress effectively.

items.question: How often should I track my mood?
items.answer: Mental health professionals typically recommend checking in 2-3 times per day - perhaps morning, afternoon, and evening. This gives you a balanced view of your emotional state throughout the day. You can set reminders in the app to help build this habit.

items.question: What is Apple Health State of Mind?
items.answer: State of Mind is Apple's mental health tracking feature introduced in iOS 18. It lets you log your momentary emotions and daily mood. Mental Health fully integrates with this feature, allowing your mood ratings to sync with Apple Health for comprehensive mental wellness tracking.

items.question: Can this app replace therapy?
items.answer: No. Mental Health is a tracking tool, not a treatment. It's designed to complement professional mental health care, not replace it. If you're struggling with your mental health, please consult a licensed therapist, counselor, or psychiatrist.

items.question: How does AI trigger detection work?
items.answer: When you add notes to your mood entries, AI analyzes the text to identify recurring words and themes. For example, if you mention "coffee with Sarah" multiple times and your mood is consistently higher on those days, the app will show that as a positive influence. This happens entirely on your device for privacy.

items.question: Is my mood data private?
items.answer: Absolutely. Your mood entries are encrypted and stored only on your device and in your private iCloud account. We never see, access, or share your mental health information. It's as private as your Apple Health data.

items.question: Can I export my mood history?
items.answer: Yes. You can export your mood data as PDF, Excel, or JSON files. Many users share these reports with their therapist or doctor to provide context for treatment discussions.

items.question: Does it work offline?
items.answer: Yes. You can log your mood anytime, even without an internet connection. Your entries will sync to iCloud when you're back online.

items.question: Can I track mood for specific conditions?
items.answer: While the app provides general mood tracking, many users find it helpful for monitoring conditions like depression, anxiety, bipolar disorder, or seasonal affective disorder. Always discuss your tracking data with your healthcare provider.

items.question: Do you show ads or track me?
items.answer:
**No.** We've completely removed all advertisements from the app. We don't track you across other apps or websites, and we never sell your data to advertisers.

Your data syncs via iCloud - just like Apple Notes and Photos. This means we don't need to know your email address, name, or any personal information. Your mental health data is stored on your devices and in your iCloud account, and it's completely private whether you use the free version or premium.

items.question: Do I need a subscription?
items.answer: The app is completely free to download and use. All core tracking features work without a subscription. A premium subscription unlocks advanced AI features, unlimited exports, and enhanced customization. You can try all premium features during the free trial period.

howItWorks.title: How Sleep & Dreams Works
howItWorks.subtitle: A complete sleep tracking solution to help you understand and improve your rest

steps.title: 1. Log Sleep Times
steps.content:
**Quick Entry:** Each morning, enter when you went to bed and when you woke up. The app automatically calculates your total sleep duration, so you don't have to do the math.

**Multiple Entries:** Track naps and multiple sleep sessions per day. Perfect for shift workers, parents with interrupted sleep, or anyone with non-traditional sleep schedules.

**Detailed Notes:** Record sleep quality ratings, dreams, nightmares, how you felt waking up, and any factors that affected your rest - caffeine intake, exercise timing, room temperature, stress levels, screen time before bed, or medications. The more details you add, the better AI can identify patterns.

steps.title: 2. Review Patterns
steps.content:
**Calendar View:** See your entire sleep history in an intuitive calendar interface. Each day displays sleep duration with color-coded indicators showing whether you met your sleep goals.

**Sleep Statistics:** Automatically calculated metrics include average sleep duration, total sleep time per week, sleep deficit/surplus, most consistent sleep schedule days, and trends over time. Identify your best and worst nights at a glance.

**Visual Trends:** Charts show your sleep patterns over days, weeks, or months. See how your bedtime and wake time vary, spot irregular patterns, and track progress toward consistent sleep schedules.

steps.title: 3. Get AI Insights
steps.content:
**Pattern Recognition:** AI analyzes your notes to identify what affects your sleep. Discover correlations like "You sleep 45 minutes longer on nights when you exercise" or "Sleep quality is worse when you have caffeine after 2 PM."

**Personalized Tips:** Get specific recommendations based on your data. AI might suggest optimal bedtimes based on when you consistently get the best sleep, or highlight factors that repeatedly disrupt your rest.

**Sleep Chat:** Ask natural language questions about your sleep data: "How many hours did I average last week?" or "Show me all nights where I got less than 6 hours." Get instant, conversational answers from your sleep history.

steps.title: 4. Improve Your Sleep
steps.content:
**Actionable Data:** Use insights to make evidence-based changes to your routine. Test hypotheses like "Will reading before bed improve my sleep?" by tracking outcomes and letting AI spot the differences.

**Professional Reports:** Export PDF or Excel reports for sleep specialists, doctors, or CPAP therapy consultations. Reports include sleep duration graphs, quality trends, notes about sleep disruptions, and statistical summaries formatted for medical review.

**Apple Health Sync:** Integrate with Apple Health to combine manual logs with automatic sleep tracking from Apple Watch or other devices. Import historical sleep data or export your logs to HealthKit for a complete health picture.

items.question: How much sleep do I need?
items.answer: Most adults need 7-9 hours of sleep per night, though individual needs vary. The app helps you track your sleep duration and identify your personal optimal amount based on how you feel.

items.question: Does this app automatically track sleep?
items.answer: No. Unlike Apple Watch or other wearables, Sleep Diary requires manual logging. You enter your sleep and wake times each morning. However, you can import sleep data from Apple Health if you use other automatic tracking devices.

items.question: Can I log naps?
items.answer: Yes. You can log multiple sleep periods per day, including naps. Each entry shows duration, and the calendar displays all your sleep/wake times.

items.question: What's the difference between this and Apple Health?
items.answer: Sleep Diary provides a dedicated interface for sleep tracking with features specifically designed for managing sleep patterns - notes, AI insights, trends, and easy manual logging. It integrates with Apple Health but offers more detailed sleep-focused features.

items.question: How does AI help with sleep insights?
items.answer: When you add notes about your day (e.g., "had coffee at 8pm" or "exercised in the morning"), AI analyzes these over time to show correlations with your sleep duration and quality. This helps identify what promotes or disrupts good sleep.

items.question: Can I share sleep data with my doctor?
items.answer: Yes. Export your sleep history as PDF or Excel reports to share with healthcare providers. This is particularly useful if you're being evaluated for sleep disorders or insomnia.

items.question: Does it track sleep quality or just duration?
items.answer: The app primarily tracks sleep duration (hours slept) based on your logged sleep and wake times. You can add notes about sleep quality, dreams, or how rested you feel, which helps with qualitative tracking.

items.question: Is there a reminder to log sleep?
items.answer: Yes. You can set daily reminders to log your sleep times. Many users set a morning reminder to prompt them to record the previous night's sleep.

items.question: Do you show ads or track me?
items.answer:
**No.** We've completely removed all advertisements from the app. We don't track you across other apps or websites, and we never sell your data to advertisers.

Your data syncs via iCloud - just like Apple Notes and Photos. This means we don't need to know your email address, name, or any personal information. Your sleep data is stored on your devices and in your iCloud account, and it's completely private whether you use the free version or premium.

items.question: Do I need a subscription?
items.answer: The app is completely free to download and use. All core tracking features work without a subscription. A premium subscription unlocks advanced AI features, unlimited exports, and enhanced customization. You can try all premium features during the free trial period.

Now getting down to reviewing this app. This app is awesome for monitoring your sleep habits, time and being able to make notes for future reference. It's simple and easy to use. I had a suggestion, something I was hoping to have changed, and the app developer Gaurav was absolutely amazing!! I reached out to him, and he got back to me within minutes and within days he actually added my suggestion! I highly recommend using this to keep a record of your sleep patterns. And it's absolutely worth subscribing to. Gaurav Sharma, you are a rockstar!!

items.content: I needed something to help with sleep tracking as I was starting CPAP therapy back in November 2022. This app has been great at keeping me accountable to a schedule and looking at my progress. I can track hours slept, dreams I have had, patterns of sleep as well as other data that I want to review. Only issue is sometimes App does not open right away on my IPAD and have to force close it and then re-open it. howItWorks.title: How Weight & Food Works
howItWorks.subtitle: Your complete weight management system with AI-powered insights

steps.title: 1. Log Your Weight & Food
steps.content:
**Scan Scale Display:** Point your camera at your scale's display and let AI automatically read your weight. Works with digital scales from any brand - no typing, no errors, just instant capture of the numbers on your scale.

**Scan Food:** Take a photo of your meal or snack and get instant nutritional analysis. AI identifies the food and provides calories, protein, carbs, fat breakdown, and portion estimates. Perfect for tracking what you eat alongside your weight.

**Manual Entry:** Prefer to type? Enter weight manually along with optional measurements like body fat percentage, BMI (auto-calculated), waist circumference, or any other metrics you track.

**Rich Context:** Add notes about your day - meals eaten, exercise completed, water intake, sleep quality, stress levels, menstrual cycle, medications, or anything that might affect your weight. Attach progress photos to visually document your journey alongside the numbers.

steps.title: 2. Track Progress
steps.content:
**Visual Tracking:** See your weight history displayed in beautiful charts and graphs. View trends over days, weeks, months, or custom date ranges. Color-coded indicators show progress toward your goals.

**Smart Averages:** Automatically calculated statistics include weekly and monthly averages that smooth out daily fluctuations, weight change rate, time-to-goal projections, and trend lines that show real progress beyond day-to-day variations.

**Milestone Celebrations:** The app recognizes and celebrates your achievements - first 5 lbs lost, 10% of goal reached, longest streak, and more. Stay motivated with visual progress indicators and achievement badges.

steps.title: 3. Discover Patterns
steps.content:
**AI Analysis:** Artificial intelligence analyzes your notes to identify what correlates with weight changes. Discover insights like "You lose more weight in weeks when you mention meal prep" or "Weight increases on weeks with less than 5 exercise sessions."

**Personalized Insights:** Get specific recommendations based on your unique data. AI might notice "Your weight drops 0.3 lbs more on weeks with morning workouts" or "Weekends show consistent 1 lb increases that normalize by Wednesday."

**Interactive Chat:** Ask questions about your data in plain English: "What's my average weight loss per week?" or "Show me all weigh-ins after cheat days." The AI understands context and delivers instant answers from your tracking history.

steps.title: 4. Reach Your Goals
steps.content:
**Goal Setting:** Set target weights with realistic timelines. The app projects when you'll reach your goal based on current trends and shows whether you're on track, ahead, or need to adjust your approach.

**Professional Reports:** Export comprehensive PDF or Excel reports for nutritionists, personal trainers, or doctors. Reports include weight graphs, BMI trends, body fat percentage changes, notes about diet and exercise, and statistical summaries perfect for professional consultations.

**Apple Health Integration:** Full bidirectional sync with Apple Health. Import weight from smart scales or other apps, and export all your WT data to HealthKit. Your weight data stays connected with your complete fitness and health ecosystem.

items.question: How does Camera Scan AI work?
items.answer: Simply point your iPhone or iPad camera at your scale's digital display. The app uses advanced AI-powered camera recognition technology to automatically read your weight and populate the field. This eliminates manual typing errors and makes logging faster and easier.

items.question: How often should I weigh myself?
items.answer: Most experts recommend weighing yourself once a week at the same time and day for consistency. Some people prefer daily weigh-ins to see the natural fluctuations. The app supports any frequency that works for you.

items.question: What is BMI and why does it matter?
items.answer: BMI (Body Mass Index) is a measure of body fat based on height and weight. It's calculated as: weight (kg) / height (m)¬≤. A BMI of 18.5-24.9 is considered normal, 25-29.9 is overweight, and 30+ is obese. The app automatically calculates and displays your BMI with color-coded indicators.

items.question: How do I measure body fat percentage?
items.answer: Body fat percentage requires a body composition scale - a special scale that measures both weight and body composition using bioelectrical impedance. These are available from brands like Omron, Tanita, and Withings. Standard scales only measure weight.

items.question: Why does my weight fluctuate daily?
items.answer: Daily weight can vary by several pounds due to water retention, salt intake, hormones, meal timing, and bathroom habits. This is completely normal. Focus on weekly or monthly trends rather than daily changes.

items.question: Can I import weight from Apple Health?
items.answer: Yes. The app can import all your historical weight data from Apple Health with one tap. This includes weight tracked by smart scales, Apple Watch, or other fitness apps.

items.question: How does AI help with weight loss?
items.answer: When you add notes to your weight entries (like "started keto" or "ate pizza"), AI analyzes these over time to show correlations. For example, it might show that weeks when you meal prep correlate with better weight loss, or that eating out frequently correlates with weight gain.

items.question: Can I track weight in pounds and kilograms?
items.answer: Yes. The app supports both imperial (pounds, feet/inches) and metric (kilograms, centimeters) units. You can switch between them in settings.

items.question: Can I export my weight data?
items.answer: Yes. Export your weight history as PDF charts, Excel spreadsheets, or JSON data. Share reports with your doctor, trainer, or nutritionist.

items.question: Is this a diet or meal tracking app?
items.answer: No. Weight & Food focuses on tracking body measurements (weight, BMI, body fat). It doesn't track calories or meals. However, you can add notes about your diet to help identify what affects your weight.

items.question: Do you show ads or track me?
items.answer:
**No.** We've completely removed all advertisements from the app. We don't track you across other apps or websites, and we never sell your data to advertisers.

Your data syncs via iCloud - just like Apple Notes and Photos. This means we don't need to know your email address, name, or any personal information. Your weight and health data is stored on your devices and in your iCloud account, and it's completely private whether you use the free version or premium.

items.question: Do I need a subscription?
items.answer: The app is completely free to download and use. All core tracking features work without a subscription. A premium subscription unlocks advanced AI features, unlimited exports, and enhanced customization. You can try all premium features during the free trial period.

hero.title: 20 Expert Tips for Blood Pressure Tracking
hero.subtitle: Master blood pressure monitoring with evidence-based guidance for accurate measurement, hypertension management, and cardiovascular health

tips.title: 1. Measure at Consistent Times Daily
tips.content: Take readings at the same times each day, ideally in the morning before medication and in the evening. [Studies show](https://www.ahajournals.org/doi/10.1161/HYP.0000000000000087) that consistent timing improves pattern recognition and helps detect variations that might indicate medication needs adjustment.

tips.title: 2. Rest Before Measuring
tips.content: Sit quietly for 5 minutes before taking a reading. The [American Heart Association](https://www.heart.org/en/health-topics/high-blood-pressure/understanding-blood-pressure-readings) recommends avoiding caffeine, exercise, and smoking for 30 minutes beforehand for accurate measurements.

tips.title: 3. Proper Arm Position Matters
tips.content: Keep your arm at heart level, supported on a table or armrest. Arm position below heart level can add 2-10 mmHg to readings, while above heart level can subtract the same amount, [according to research](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4579512/).

tips.title: 4. Use the Correct Cuff Size
tips.content: An incorrectly sized cuff can cause readings to be off by up to 10-40 mmHg. Measure your upper arm circumference and use a cuff that covers 80% of the arm. Most adults need a standard adult cuff (bladder 12-13 cm wide, 35 cm long).

tips.title: 5. Take Multiple Readings
tips.content: Take 2-3 readings one minute apart and record the average. The [NICE guidelines](https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/ng136) recommend this approach for more reliable results and to account for natural blood pressure variability.

tips.title: 6. Empty Your Bladder First
tips.content: A full bladder can increase blood pressure readings by 10-15 mmHg. Always use the restroom before taking measurements to ensure accuracy.

tips.title: 7. Reduce Sodium Intake
tips.content: Limit sodium to less than 2,300 mg per day, ideally 1,500 mg for most adults with hypertension. The [DASH diet](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5125486/) has been shown to reduce systolic pressure by 8-14 mmHg when combined with sodium restriction.

tips.title: 8. Exercise Regularly
tips.content: Aim for 150 minutes of moderate aerobic activity weekly. [Meta-analyses show](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6557179/) regular exercise can lower systolic BP by 5-8 mmHg and diastolic BP by 2-5 mmHg.

tips.title: 9. Maintain Healthy Weight
tips.content: Each kilogram of weight loss can reduce blood pressure by approximately 1 mmHg. Even modest weight loss of 5-10% of body weight can significantly improve blood pressure control.

tips.title: 10. Limit Alcohol Consumption
tips.content: Men should limit alcohol to 2 drinks per day, women to 1 drink. Excessive alcohol consumption can raise BP by several points and reduce the effectiveness of blood pressure medications.

tips.title: 11. Follow the DASH Diet
tips.content: The [DASH eating plan](https://www.nhlbi.nih.gov/education/dash-eating-plan) emphasizes fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and low-fat dairy while limiting saturated fat and cholesterol. This approach can reduce BP by 8-14 mmHg.

tips.title: 12. Prioritize Quality Sleep
tips.content: Aim for 7-9 hours of quality sleep nightly. [Research indicates](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6377924/) that poor sleep quality and sleep disorders like sleep apnea are associated with resistant hypertension.

tips.title: 13. Track Patterns Over Time
tips.content: Look for trends rather than focusing on individual readings. Blood pressure naturally varies throughout the day. Use Blood Pressure's AI-powered insights to identify patterns and share comprehensive reports with your doctor.

tips.title: 14. Take Medications as Prescribed
tips.content: Medication adherence is crucial. [Studies show](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6072926/) that poor medication adherence is responsible for up to 50% of treatment failures. Use medication reminders in your tracking app.

tips.title: 15. Document Contributing Factors
tips.content: Record factors that might affect readings: stress levels, physical activity, meals, sleep quality, and alcohol consumption. This context helps you and your doctor understand fluctuations and adjust treatment.

tips.title: 16. Share Data with Your Doctor
tips.content: Export your blood pressure logs regularly and share them at appointments. Home monitoring provides [more accurate predictions](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5436815/) of cardiovascular risk than office measurements alone.

tips.title: 17. Monitor White Coat Hypertension
tips.content: If your readings are consistently higher at the doctor's office than at home, you may have white coat hypertension. Home monitoring helps differentiate this from true hypertension, potentially avoiding unnecessary medication.

tips.title: 18. Track Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP)
tips.content: MAP is calculated as (2√ódiastolic + systolic) √∑ 3 and represents average blood pressure during one cardiac cycle. A MAP of 70-100 mmHg is typically normal. Blood Pressure automatically calculates this important metric.

tips.title: 19. Monitor Heart Rate Along with BP
tips.content: Elevated resting heart rate can indicate cardiovascular stress. A [normal resting heart rate](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3751016/) is 60-100 bpm, with lower rates often indicating better cardiovascular fitness.

tips.title: 20. Use Technology to Stay Consistent
tips.content: Use Camera Scan AI in Blood Pressure to automatically capture readings from your monitor screen, sync with Apple Health for comprehensive tracking, and set reminders to maintain consistency. Technology makes tracking effortless and improves long-term adherence.

hero.title: 20 Expert Tips for Daily Journaling & Self-Reflection
hero.subtitle: Transform your life through journaling with evidence-based strategies for gratitude, mindfulness, personal growth, and mental clarity

tips.title: 1. Journal at the Same Time Daily
tips.content: Establish a consistent routine by journaling at the same time each day. [Research shows](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3505409/) that habit formation is strengthened by temporal consistency, making journaling more sustainable long-term.

tips.title: 2. Start Small and Build Gradually
tips.content: Begin with just 5 minutes daily rather than ambitious hour-long sessions. Small, consistent efforts are more sustainable than sporadic intensive writing. Gradually increase duration as the habit solidifies.

tips.title: 3. Write Without Judgment
tips.content: Let thoughts flow freely without editing or censoring. [Expressive writing research](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6421543/) demonstrates that unfiltered expression provides greater therapeutic benefit than polished prose.

tips.title: 4. Use Prompts When Stuck
tips.content: Keep a list of prompts for days when inspiration doesn't strike: "What am I grateful for?", "What challenged me today?", "What did I learn?". Prompts maintain momentum and explore different aspects of experience.

tips.title: 5. Journal Anywhere with Digital Tools
tips.content: Use Daily Journaling to journal on your phone, tablet, or computer. Digital journaling removes barriers - capture thoughts in the moment rather than waiting until you're home with a physical notebook.

tips.title: 6. Don't Skip Days - Keep It Simple
tips.content: On difficult days, write just one sentence. Consistency matters more than length. Even brief entries maintain the habit and provide valuable data points for tracking your journey.

tips.title: 7. Practice Gratitude Journaling
tips.content: List 3-5 things you're grateful for daily. [Studies show](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3010965/) gratitude journaling increases wellbeing, life satisfaction, and optimism while reducing depression symptoms.

tips.title: 8. Try Stream of Consciousness Writing
tips.content: Set a timer for 10 minutes and write continuously without stopping. This technique, also called "morning pages," bypasses your inner critic and accesses deeper thoughts and feelings.

tips.title: 9. Set and Track Goals
tips.content: Document goals, action steps, and progress. [Goal-setting research](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6437458/) confirms that written goals with regular progress reviews significantly increase achievement likelihood.

tips.title: 10. Reflect on Problems and Solutions
tips.content: Use journaling for problem-solving: describe the issue, brainstorm solutions, and evaluate options. Writing clarifies thinking and often reveals insights that remain hidden in mental rumination.

tips.title: 11. Celebrate Small Wins
tips.content: Record daily accomplishments, no matter how minor. Acknowledging progress builds self-efficacy and motivation. Look back at these entries during difficult times for perspective.

tips.title: 12. Use Different Journaling Formats
tips.content: Experiment with bullet journals, prompted entries, free writing, or letter writing. Variety prevents monotony and engages different cognitive processes for comprehensive self-exploration.

tips.title: 13. Process Difficult Emotions
tips.content: Write about traumatic or stressful experiences using the [Pennebaker paradigm](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4155664/): 15-20 minutes on consecutive days about your deepest thoughts and feelings. This reduces intrusive thoughts and improves mental health.

tips.title: 14. Track Anxiety and Worry Patterns
tips.content: Document anxious thoughts and review them later. Often worries don't materialize, and seeing this pattern helps reduce anxiety's grip. Track what actually happened versus what you feared.

tips.title: 15. Identify Cognitive Distortions
tips.content: Recognize thinking errors like all-or-nothing thinking, overgeneralization, or catastrophizing. Writing makes these patterns visible and enables you to challenge and reframe unhelpful thoughts.

tips.title: 16. Practice Self-Compassion
tips.content: Write to yourself with kindness, especially after setbacks. [Self-compassion research](https://self-compassion.org/the-three-elements-of-self-compassion-2/) shows this reduces self-criticism, increases resilience, and improves emotional wellbeing.

tips.title: 17. Clarify Values and Purpose
tips.content: Regularly reflect on what matters most to you and whether your actions align with your values. This creates meaning and guides decision-making toward a more fulfilling life.

tips.title: 18. Document Personal Growth
tips.content: Note lessons learned, skills developed, and how you've changed. Reviewing past entries reveals growth that's invisible in the present moment and reinforces progress.

tips.title: 19. Review Past Entries Regularly
tips.content: Schedule weekly or monthly reviews of previous entries. [Reflection on reflection](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4721946/) deepens self-understanding, reveals patterns, and tracks long-term progress that daily writing alone cannot provide.

tips.title: 20. Ensure Privacy and Security
tips.content: Write honestly by protecting your privacy. Use Daily Journaling's secure, encrypted journaling with passcode protection. Knowing your thoughts are private enables the vulnerability necessary for authentic self-exploration and growth.

hero.title: 20 Expert Tips for Mood Tracking & Emotional Wellbeing
hero.subtitle: Master DBT skills, emotional regulation, and mental health tracking with evidence-based strategies for anxiety, depression, and BPD management

tips.title: 1. Track Multiple Times Daily
tips.content: Record your mood at consistent intervals throughout the day. [Research shows](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5501015/) that frequent mood assessments provide better insight into mood patterns and triggers than single daily entries.

tips.title: 2. Identify Triggers and Patterns
tips.content: Document what happened before mood changes: events, interactions, thoughts, or physical sensations. Pattern recognition is essential for [DBT therapy](https://behavioraltech.org/resources/faqs/dialectical-behavior-therapy-dbt/) and helps develop targeted coping strategies.

tips.title: 3. Use a Detailed Mood Scale
tips.content: Go beyond "good" or "bad" - use specific emotions like anxious, irritable, hopeful, or content. Emotional granularity improves [emotional regulation](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5150208/) and helps communicate more effectively with therapists.

tips.title: 4. Note Physical Sensations
tips.content: Track bodily experiences alongside emotions: tension, fatigue, restlessness, or pain. The mind-body connection is crucial for understanding mood states and implementing effective interventions.

tips.title: 5. Record Automatic Thoughts
tips.content: Capture negative or distorted thoughts when they occur. [Cognitive behavioral therapy](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2882379/) emphasizes identifying thought patterns to challenge and reframe them effectively.

tips.title: 6. Track Positive Moments Too
tips.content: Don't only log negative experiences. Recording positive events and emotions builds awareness of what brings joy and helps counteract negativity bias in depression.

tips.title: 7. Practice Mindfulness Daily
tips.content: Use the WHAT skills (Observe, Describe, Participate) and HOW skills (Non-judgmentally, One-mindfully, Effectively). [Studies demonstrate](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3303604/) mindfulness reduces emotional reactivity and improves mood regulation.

tips.title: 8. Master Distress Tolerance
tips.content: Learn TIPP skills (Temperature, Intense exercise, Paced breathing, Paired muscle relaxation) for crisis moments. Track which techniques work best for you during high-distress situations.

tips.title: 9. Build Emotional Regulation Skills
tips.content: Practice PLEASE skills: treat PhysicaL illness, balance Eating, avoid mood-Altering substances, balance Sleep, and Exercise. [Research confirms](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3579493/) these foundational habits significantly impact emotional stability.

tips.title: 10. Apply Interpersonal Effectiveness
tips.content: Use DEAR MAN (Describe, Express, Assert, Reinforce, Mindful, Appear confident, Negotiate) for healthy communication. Track interpersonal interactions and outcomes to refine your approach.

tips.title: 11. Reduce Vulnerability to Emotion Mind
tips.content: Accumulate positive experiences, build mastery through achievable goals, and cope ahead for difficult situations. Document these activities to reinforce their importance and track effectiveness.

tips.title: 12. Practice Opposite Action
tips.content: When emotions don't fit the facts, act opposite to the emotional urge. Track situations where you used opposite action and note the outcomes - this DBT skill is particularly effective for depression and anxiety.

tips.title: 13. Monitor Medication Effects
tips.content: Track mood changes after starting or adjusting medications. [Documentation helps](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3712503/) your psychiatrist optimize treatment and identify side effects early.

tips.title: 14. Track Sleep Quality
tips.content: Poor sleep exacerbates mood disorders. Document sleep duration, quality, and how it affects your mood. [Sleep disturbance](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3181883/) is both a symptom and risk factor for depression and anxiety.

tips.title: 15. Note Diet and Mood Connection
tips.content: Track what you eat and how it affects your mood. [Emerging research](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6087749/) shows strong links between gut health, nutrition, and mental wellbeing.

tips.title: 16. Share Insights with Your Therapist
tips.content: Export your mood data and bring it to therapy sessions. Visual representations of mood patterns facilitate more productive discussions and help track treatment progress over time.

tips.title: 17. Identify Early Warning Signs
tips.content: Learn your unique indicators of declining mental health: sleep changes, social withdrawal, or increased irritability. Early recognition enables proactive intervention before crisis.

tips.title: 18. Use Validated Assessment Tools
tips.content: Incorporate standardized measures like PHQ-9 for depression or GAD-7 for anxiety. These [evidence-based tools](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1495268/) provide objective measures of symptom severity.

tips.title: 19. Set Regular Tracking Reminders
tips.content: Use notifications to build a consistent tracking habit. Consistency is key for accurate pattern recognition and therapeutic benefit. Even tracking during good periods provides valuable baseline data.

tips.title: 20. Review Trends Weekly
tips.content: Set aside time each week to review your mood patterns, identify improvements, and adjust strategies. Use Mental Health's AI insights to discover trends you might miss. Celebrate small victories and learn from difficult periods.

hero.title: 20 Expert Tips for Sleep Quality & CPAP Therapy
hero.subtitle: Achieve restorative sleep with evidence-based strategies for sleep hygiene, CPAP compliance, sleep apnea management, and optimal sleep health

tips.title: 1. Maintain a Consistent Sleep Schedule
tips.content: Go to bed and wake up at the same time daily, including weekends. [Research shows](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6267703/) regular sleep-wake timing strengthens circadian rhythms and improves sleep quality more than extending sleep duration irregularly.

tips.title: 2. Create a Dark Sleep Environment
tips.content: Use blackout curtains or an eye mask. [Light exposure](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6751071/) suppresses melatonin production and disrupts circadian rhythms. Even small amounts of light can reduce sleep quality.

tips.title: 3. Keep Your Bedroom Cool
tips.content: Maintain bedroom temperature between 60-67¬∞F (15-19¬∞C). Core body temperature naturally drops during sleep, and a cool environment [facilitates this process](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3427038/), promoting faster sleep onset and better quality.

tips.title: 4. Minimize Noise Disruption
tips.content: Use earplugs, white noise machines, or fans to mask disruptive sounds. Noise fragments sleep and prevents deep restorative stages, even when you don't consciously wake.

tips.title: 5. Limit Screen Time Before Bed
tips.content: Avoid screens 1-2 hours before sleep. [Blue light from devices](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6751071/) suppresses melatonin and delays sleep onset. Use night mode or blue light filters if screen use is unavoidable.

tips.title: 6. Use Your Bed Only for Sleep
tips.content: Avoid working, watching TV, or eating in bed. This strengthens the psychological association between bed and sleep, making it easier to fall asleep when you lie down.

tips.title: 7. Find the Right Mask Fit
tips.content: Try different mask styles (nasal, nasal pillow, full face) to find your best fit. [Proper mask fit](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5337595/) is the strongest predictor of CPAP compliance. Leaks and discomfort are the primary reasons for therapy abandonment.

tips.title: 8. Clean Your CPAP Equipment Regularly
tips.content: Wash mask daily with mild soap and water, clean tubing weekly, and replace filters monthly. Poor hygiene causes infections, skin irritation, and equipment deterioration that reduces therapy effectiveness.

tips.title: 9. Use Heated Humidification
tips.content: Add a heated humidifier to reduce nasal dryness, congestion, and irritation. [Humidification improves](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4623987/) CPAP tolerance and compliance, especially in dry climates or during winter.

tips.title: 10. Monitor Your CPAP Data
tips.content: Track AHI (Apnea-Hypopnea Index), leak rates, and usage hours using Sleep & Dreams. Monitoring helps identify problems early and demonstrates therapy effectiveness to your sleep physician.

tips.title: 11. Practice Wearing Your Mask
tips.content: Wear your mask during the day while awake to acclimate. Practice breathing through your nose with the mask on. Gradual exposure reduces anxiety and speeds adaptation to therapy.

tips.title: 12. Adjust Pressure Ramp Settings
tips.content: Use ramp features that start at lower pressure and gradually increase. This makes falling asleep more comfortable while ensuring therapeutic pressure during sleep cycles.

tips.title: 13. Limit Caffeine Intake
tips.content: Avoid caffeine 6-8 hours before bed. Caffeine has a [half-life of 5-6 hours](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5445139/), meaning half remains in your system hours later, disrupting sleep onset and reducing deep sleep stages.

tips.title: 14. Avoid Alcohol Before Bed
tips.content: While alcohol may help you fall asleep faster, it [fragments sleep](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2775419/), reduces REM sleep, and worsens sleep apnea by relaxing throat muscles. Avoid alcohol 3-4 hours before bed.

tips.title: 15. Exercise Regularly, But Time It Right
tips.content: Regular exercise improves sleep quality, but [avoid vigorous exercise](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4341978/) within 2-3 hours of bedtime. Physical activity raises body temperature and arousal, making sleep onset difficult.

tips.title: 16. Watch Evening Meal Timing
tips.content: Finish eating 2-3 hours before bed. Large, heavy, or spicy meals cause digestive discomfort and acid reflux that disrupt sleep. Light evening snacks are acceptable if you're hungry.

tips.title: 17. Maintain Healthy Weight
tips.content: Weight loss significantly improves sleep apnea. [Studies show](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3021364/) that 10% weight reduction can decrease AHI by 26% in obese patients with moderate-to-severe OSA.

tips.title: 18. Develop a Relaxing Bedtime Routine
tips.content: Create a 30-60 minute wind-down routine: reading, gentle stretching, meditation, or warm bath. [Consistent pre-sleep routines](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6171441/) signal your body that sleep is approaching, facilitating the transition.

tips.title: 19. Get Bright Light Exposure in Morning
tips.content: Expose yourself to bright light within 30-60 minutes of waking. [Morning light](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6751071/) anchors circadian rhythms, increases daytime alertness, and improves nighttime sleep quality.

tips.title: 20. Track and Analyze Your Sleep Patterns
tips.content: Use Sleep & Dreams to monitor sleep duration, quality, CPAP usage, and AHI scores. Consistent tracking reveals patterns, identifies problems, and helps optimize your sleep strategy. Share data with your sleep physician for treatment adjustments and better outcomes.

hero.title: 20 Expert Tips for Weight Management & BMI Tracking
hero.subtitle: Achieve sustainable weight loss and fitness goals with evidence-based strategies for healthy weight management and body composition tracking

tips.title: 1. Weigh Yourself Consistently
tips.content: Weigh yourself at the same time daily, ideally in the morning after using the bathroom and before eating. [Research shows](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4380831/) daily weighing improves weight loss outcomes and prevents weight regain.

tips.title: 2. Focus on Trends, Not Daily Fluctuations
tips.content: Weight naturally fluctuates 2-5 pounds daily due to water retention, sodium intake, and digestive contents. Track the trend line over weeks rather than obsessing over day-to-day changes.

tips.title: 3. Understand BMI Limitations
tips.content: BMI is a useful screening tool but doesn't distinguish muscle from fat. [Athletes and muscular individuals](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4890841/) may have high BMI despite healthy body composition. Use BMI alongside other metrics.

tips.title: 4. Take Body Measurements
tips.content: Measure waist, hips, chest, arms, and thighs monthly. Body composition changes may occur without scale movement, especially when building muscle. Measurements reveal progress the scale misses.

tips.title: 5. Track Body Fat Percentage
tips.content: Monitor body composition, not just weight. Losing fat while maintaining muscle is healthier than losing both. Consider bioelectrical impedance scales or professional DEXA scans for accuracy.

tips.title: 6. Take Progress Photos
tips.content: Photograph yourself weekly in the same lighting, clothing, and poses. Visual changes often occur before significant scale movement, providing motivation during weight loss plateaus.

tips.title: 7. Create a Sustainable Calorie Deficit
tips.content: Aim for 500-750 calorie daily deficit for 1-1.5 pounds weekly loss. [Gradual weight loss](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3856431/) is more sustainable and preserves muscle mass better than aggressive dieting.

tips.title: 8. Prioritize Protein Intake
tips.content: Consume 0.7-1 gram of protein per pound of body weight. [High protein intake](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4258944/) preserves muscle during weight loss, increases satiety, and boosts metabolism through the thermic effect of food.

tips.title: 9. Eat Whole, Minimally Processed Foods
tips.content: Focus on vegetables, fruits, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats. Whole foods provide more nutrients and fiber per calorie, increasing satiety and supporting sustainable weight management.

tips.title: 10. Stay Hydrated
tips.content: Drink adequate water throughout the day. [Studies suggest](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6209729/) drinking water before meals may reduce calorie intake and support weight loss, plus dehydration can be mistaken for hunger.

tips.title: 11. Practice Mindful Eating
tips.content: Eat slowly, without distractions, paying attention to hunger and fullness cues. Mindful eating reduces overeating, improves food enjoyment, and helps recognize emotional versus physical hunger.

tips.title: 12. Track Your Food Intake
tips.content: [Food logging](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6893459/) doubles weight loss success rates. Track calories, macronutrients, and meal timing to identify patterns, portion creep, and areas for improvement.

tips.title: 13. Incorporate Strength Training
tips.content: Lift weights 2-4 times weekly. [Resistance training](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6950543/) builds muscle, increases metabolism, and improves body composition. Muscle burns more calories at rest than fat tissue.

tips.title: 14. Add Cardiovascular Exercise
tips.content: Include 150-300 minutes of moderate cardio weekly. Aerobic exercise burns calories, improves cardiovascular health, and supports weight management when combined with diet.

tips.title: 15. Increase Daily Movement
tips.content: Boost NEAT (Non-Exercise Activity Thermogenesis) through walking, taking stairs, and active hobbies. [NEAT can burn](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4271572/) 300-700 calories daily and significantly impacts weight management.

tips.title: 16. Track Your Steps
tips.content: Aim for 7,000-10,000 daily steps. Step tracking provides objective activity data and motivates increased movement. Sync Weight & Food with Apple Health to monitor activity alongside weight.

tips.title: 17. Prioritize Quality Sleep
tips.content: Get 7-9 hours nightly. [Sleep deprivation](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3632337/) disrupts hunger hormones (ghrelin and leptin), increases cravings, reduces willpower, and promotes fat storage.

tips.title: 18. Manage Stress Effectively
tips.content: Chronic stress elevates cortisol, promoting abdominal fat storage and emotional eating. Practice stress management through meditation, exercise, or journaling to support weight goals.

tips.title: 19. Set Realistic Goals
tips.content: Aim for 0.5-2 pounds weekly weight loss depending on starting weight. [Realistic goals](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5764193/) prevent disappointment, maintain motivation, and promote sustainable habits over quick fixes.

tips.title: 20. View Weight Management as Lifelong
tips.content: Focus on sustainable lifestyle changes rather than temporary diets. Use Weight & Food's long-term tracking and AI insights to maintain progress, identify patterns, and adjust strategies. Success requires permanent habit changes, not short-term restriction.

feeltracker

About Feeltracker

The leading suite of AI-powered health tracking applications for iOS, trusted by over 500,000 users worldwide

  • Developer: Custom Arts
  • Total Applications: 5 health tracking apps
  • Total Users: 500,000+ downloads
  • Total Reviews: 18,565+ reviews
  • Average Rating: 4.8 stars across all apps
  • Languages Supported: 33 languages with full localization
  • Years in Operation: 10+ years (since 2015)
  • Platforms: iOS, iPadOS, macOS (Apple Silicon M1+)

Awards and Recognition

  • üèÜ Number 1 Blood Pressure Tracking App in the United Kingdom
  • Top-rated cardiovascular health application worldwide
  • Featured by healthcare professionals and sleep doctors
  • Trusted by users with chronic conditions including hypertension, bipolar disorder, and sleep apnea

Our Applications

1. Blood Pressure

App Store ID: 794542324 | Rating: 4.8/5 (16,702+ reviews)

Ranking: Number 1 blood pressure tracking app in the United Kingdom App Store

Category: Health & Fitness - Cardiovascular Health Monitoring

Description: The leading blood pressure tracking application in the UK, featuring AI-powered insights and Camera Scan technology. Monitor systolic and diastolic blood pressure, heart rate, and Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP) with seamless Apple Health integration.

Key Features:

  • Camera Scan AI - Automatically reads values from blood pressure monitor screens (OMRON, Microlife, Beurer, and other digital monitors)
  • Systolic and diastolic blood pressure tracking
  • Heart rate and pulse monitoring
  • Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP) automatic calculation
  • Bidirectional Apple Health sync
  • AI-powered pattern detection identifying lifestyle factors affecting blood pressure
  • Export to PDF and Excel for healthcare provider sharing
  • Multiple readings per day with timestamp tracking
  • Medication tracking and correlation analysis
  • Calendar view with color-coded indicators for normal, elevated, and high readings

Best For: Hypertension management, home blood pressure monitoring, medication effectiveness tracking, white coat syndrome documentation, cardiovascular health monitoring

Learn more about Blood Pressure Tracker | Download on App Store

2. Mental Health

App Store ID: 687448999 | Rating: 4.8/5 (355 reviews)

Category: Health & Fitness - Mental Health & Mood Tracking

Description: Monitor emotional health with daily mood ratings, AI-powered trigger identification, and Apple Health Mental Health integration (iOS 18+ State of Mind).

Key Features:

  • Simple 5-point mood rating scale
  • iOS 18+ Mental Health (State of Mind) integration with Apple Health
  • AI-powered trigger identification and pattern detection
  • Sentiment analysis of journal entries
  • Visual mood charts and trend analysis
  • Support for DBT (Dialectical Behavior Therapy) and CBT (Cognitive Behavioral Therapy) practices
  • Private notes with encryption
  • Export capabilities for therapist sharing

Best For: Bipolar disorder tracking, borderline personality disorder (BPD) management, PTSD symptom monitoring, anxiety and depression tracking, ADHD emotional regulation, general mental health awareness

Learn more about Mood Tracker | Download on App Store

3. Daily Journaling

App Store ID: 1557699226 | Rating: 4.8/5 (778 reviews)

Category: Health & Fitness - Journaling & Notes

Description: Simple, distraction-free journaling application with AI sentiment analysis, word frequency tracking for theme identification, and photo attachment support.

Key Features:

  • Distraction-free journaling interface
  • AI sentiment analysis of entries
  • Word frequency analysis to identify recurring themes
  • Note templates for quick entries
  • Up to 8 photos per entry
  • Optional markdown rendering support
  • Full-text search across all entries
  • iOS Spotlight integration for system-wide search
  • Export to PDF, Excel, and JSON formats

Best For: Daily reflection and gratitude journaling, life event documentation, private diary keeping, creative writing, tracking personal growth

Learn more about Daily Journaling | Download on App Store

4. Weight & Food

Category: Health & Fitness - Weight & Body Composition

  • Full Apple Health bidirectional sync

Best For: Weight loss tracking, body composition monitoring, fitness goal progress, health metric documentation for medical purposes

Learn more about Weight Tracker | Download on App Store

5. Sleep & Dreams

App Store ID: 1065268459 | Rating: 4.7/5 (237 reviews)

Category: Health & Fitness - Sleep Tracking

Description: Monitor sleep patterns, duration, and quality with Apple Health integration, CPAP therapy tracking, and AI-powered insights.

Key Features:

  • Sleep and wake time logging
  • Automatic sleep duration calculation
  • Apple Health sleep data integration
  • CPAP (Continuous Positive Airway Pressure) therapy tracking
  • Sleep apnea monitoring support
  • AI insights into sleep pattern factors
  • Visual charts and sleep statistics
  • Dream logging and notes

Best For: Sleep disorder documentation, CPAP therapy monitoring, sleep apnea management, insomnia pattern identification, sleep quality optimization, sleep study preparation

Learn more about Sleep Tracker | Download on App Store

Technology & Features

Artificial Intelligence Capabilities

All Feeltracker apps are powered by advanced AI technology:

  • Camera Scan AI (OCR): Automatically reads values from device screens - blood pressure monitors, weight scales, and other health devices
  • Conversational Chat Assistant: Ask questions about your health data in natural language
  • Automatic Insight Generation: AI analyzes your data and generates personalized insights
  • Pattern Detection: Identifies correlations between lifestyle factors and health metrics
  • Sentiment Analysis: Understands emotional tone in journal entries
  • Text-to-Speech: Listen to insights and summaries

Apple Health Integration

Comprehensive bidirectional integration with Apple HealthKit:

  • Read: Import historical health data from Apple Health
  • Write: Automatically save new entries to HealthKit
  • Supported Data Types: Blood pressure, heart rate, weight, body fat percentage, BMI, sleep analysis, mental health (iOS 18+ State of Mind)
  • Automatic Sync: Background synchronization across all iOS devices

Privacy and Security

  • End-to-End Encryption: All health data is encrypted
  • iCloud Storage: Data stored only in user's private iCloud account
  • No Server Storage: Data never passes through external servers
  • Complete Ownership: Users have full control and ownership of their data
  • GDPR Compliant: Meets European data protection standards
  • No Data Selling: User data is never sold or shared with third parties

Export and Sharing

  • PDF Reports: Professionally formatted reports for healthcare providers
